title: PFAS found in plant-based and plastic straws | Sustainable Plastics
body: For plastic straws, it was difficult to predict the presence of PFAS due to the variety of plastics and additives used. The paper straws were indeed found to be the most likely to contain PFAS; however, for both plant-based straws -made from paper or bamboo - it was not clear whether the contamination with PFAS had occurred during plant growth ...
readable_content:
- Sure, here's the relevant information from the source:
The study reveals that PFAS (poly- and perfluoroalkyl substances) are found in straws made from plant-based materials such as paper or bamboo. PFAS are synthetic chemicals that are organic compounds produced and used on a large industrial scale for various applications. These substances are known to be accumulative and potentially toxic to humans and animals and have been associated with health problems. The study found PFAS in almost all types of straws, except those made of stainless steel.
The presence of PFAS in paper and bamboo straws challenges the belief that they are more sustainable and eco-friendly than plastic straws. The study concludes that plant-based straws can also be considered as an additional source of PFAS exposure in humans and the environment.
The researchers advise consumers to use stainless steel straws or to avoid using straws altogether due to the presence of PFAS in paper and bamboo straws.

(Source: Sustainable Plastics, August 31, 2023)

The study recommends using stainless steel straws or avoiding straws altogether due to the presence of PFAS in paper and bamboo straws.
